programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: The discovery of Travis Alexander's body, stabbed, slit and shot in the neck, shocked his friends and family; Arizona police charge his girlfriend Jodi Arias with his murder.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Mark Sievers thought he had arranged the perfect murder when he hired a childhood friend and another man to murder his wife, Dr. Teresa Sievers; his best laid plan started falling apart when someone he trusted the most turned on him.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Years after being found not guilty of the murders of Nicole Brown Simpson and Ron Goldman, OJ Simpson was back in a courtroom and again facing felony charges.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Prosecutors said Dalia Dippolito was involved with another man during her marriage to Michael.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Dalia's former lover claimed that she first asked him to kill her husband Michael; he refused and pleaded with her to divorce him.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Dalia's friend testified on video that she told him Michael was abusing her mentally and physically during their marriage.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Dalia Dipplito's close friend became a confidential informant for law enforcement in this alleged murder-for-hire-plot.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.sub-title: Financial Crimes to a Murder Plot
programme.desc: Financial crimes played a big role in the investigation.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.sub-title: Catching Dalia in Her Murder Plot
programme.desc: The alleged murder-for-hire plot targeting Michael Dippolito sounds like a Hollywood script; detectives urge a reality show crew to roll their cameras on a staged crime scene.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: An episode of a long-running show "Cops" played a key role in one of the most high-profile cases in the history of the Boynton Beach Police Department.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The Boynton Beach Police Department reached out to the producers of the reality TV show "Cops" not once but twice right before officers were tipped off about the alleged murder-for-hire plot targeting Michael Dippolito.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The whereabouts of the defendant is key for jurors to determine if Kit Martin fatally shot three of his neighbors and attempted to cover his tracks; prosecutors introduce the communication and cell phone activity.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: A heated debate between both sides; the judge pauses testimony of the digital forensics examiner; outside the presence of the jury, all the lawyers argue over documents of cell phone extraction done on the three victims.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: The Guns Used in the Murders
programme.desc: Prosecutors bring in details about the two firearms used to kill three of his neighbors; a firearm examiner tests the two guns used in the homicides, the shell casings and bullet fragments recovered in police's investigation.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors believe the forensic analysis of the hair, blood, DNA, and even the firearm used in the murders linked Kit Martin to the fatal shootings of Calvin and Pamela Phillips and their next-door neighbor, Ed Dansereau.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The state's final witness takes the stand, Dr. Randall Falls, who conducted the autopsy of Calvin Phillips; prosecutors believe Calvin is the main target of the defendant.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The State rests their case against Kit Martin for the triple murders of his neighbors; his defense motions to the judge for dismissal of the charges claiming prosecutors lack evidence for jurors to convict the defendant.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors listen to more testimony from Canton, Mass. friends of John O'Keefe; jurors hear details of the bar scene where John O'Keefe and his girlfriend Karen Read were hanging out just before he died.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors watch more of the bar video; friends of John O'Keefe had joined him at two different bars the night he was found unconscious outside in a snowstorm; jurors hear from a member of the Albert family.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Friends of John O'Keefe remember everybody was having a good time in the bar outing hours before he died; Chris Albert and his brother, Brian, happened to be in the same local bar.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Invite To The Albert Family House Party
programme.desc: Karen Read's defense team presents a conspiracy theory about what really happened to John O'Keefe; a member of a Canton family is on the stand; the defense is trying to disprove the state's case that the defendant wanted to kill her boyfriend.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Another member of the influential Canton, Mass. family continues her testimony; Julie Albert testifies that she was at the same bar outing with the defendant, Karen Read, and her boyfriend, John O'Keefe.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Albert Family Connection With Lead Investigator
programme.desc: Julie Albert is on the stand under cross-examination; she was with both the defendant and her boyfriend, John O'Keefe hours before he was found unresponsive in the front yard of the Albert family home.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Ten years after being found guilty of the murder of her husband, Susie Mowbray's conviction was overturned, and she would once again face a jury of her peers.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: While driving under the influence of drugs and alcohol, Chante Mallard allegedly struck pedestrian Gregory Biggs, impaling him in the windshield; what she did and didn't do next, is what turned a terrible accident into a shocking case of murder.
